proteomicsdb.org.requesttool.model.request

Class RunnableRequestHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • proteomicsdb.org.requesttool.model.request.RequestHandler
      • proteomicsdb.org.requesttool.model.request.RunnableRequestHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, RequestNotifier

    public class RunnableRequestHandler
extends RequestHandler
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The runnable version of the RequestHandler. Basically adds only the run method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RunnableRequestHandler

        public RunnableRequestHandler(InputConfigurationValidated anInputConf,
                      OutputConfiguration anOutputConf,
                      RequestThreadPool theRequestThreadPool)
        Gets the same things as the RequestHandler, and just calls the super constructor.
        Parameters:
        anInputConf - The InputConfigurationValidated that is used to build the link
        anOutputConf - The OutputConfiguration that describes how the data shall be written
        theRequestThreadPool - The RequestThreadPool that is used as RequestListener; this is needed to be able to enqueue this RunnableRequestHandler in the WritingThread

    • Method Detail

      • getRunnableRequestHandlerForErrorMessage

        public static RunnableRequestHandler getRunnableRequestHandlerForErrorMessage(InputConfigurationValidated anInputConfWithOnlyCurrentAPI,
                                                              RequestListener aListener)
        This method is used by Control to include requests, where the InputConfiguration is invalid, in the ProgressPanel Usually, without a valid InputConfiguration, no {link RequestHandler} can be constructed, because its constructor already builds the link. This is why this method uses a special private constructor to include an invalid InputConfiguration in a RequestHandler. This RunnableRequestHandler can then be put into the ProgressPanel, and its state can be set to RequestEvent.INPUT_ERROR, including the InvalidInputException that occurred.
        Parameters:
        anInputConfWithOnlyCurrentAPI - An InputConfiguration, that only has the current API set, but no checked values, that hence can build no valid link.
        aListener - A RequestListener
        Returns:
        A dummy RunnableRequestHandler, that can be used only to display error messages, but can send no request.

      • run

        public void run()
        This method implements the Runnable interface. It only calls RequestHandler.request() and then sets its state to RequestEvent.READY_TO_WRITE, to then be enqueued in the WritingThread. The structure of parallelizing the requests looks like this: The RunnableRequestHandlers are executed parallely, though they number is limited by the RequestThreadPool. When they indicate, that the request is finished, they are given to the WritingThread, so it can then handle the writes, which are not parallel. It is important, that not only the data, but also the RequestHandler is given to the WritingThread, so that it calls RequestHandler.dumpData(), so that progress information is still handed out.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
